READ ME - Report Generation Endpoint API
info:
This endpoint is not used in these demo flows since we
utilise the built-in WS communications of FlowFuse/Dashboard
to transmit the PDF data from the backend to the frontend.

However, we provided this endpoint example of how to utilise
the PDF report generator in other applications or even other
dashboard offerings like uibuilder.

### Example URL
([https://<your-instance-url>/api/shift-report-pdf/BPHP/123])[https://<your-instance-url>/api/shift-report-pdf/BPHP/123]
Where `BPHP` is the facility ID and `123` is the Run ID (planned shift ID)

name: READ ME...
info:
### PDF Generator flows

This flow tab is where the PDF doc def (Document Definition)
is generated and converted to a PDF document.

The PDF is never saved to file, instead it is transmitted
in binary format for the caller to offer as a download to
the user.

There is also an API endpoint example which exposes the PDF
generator to external application. See the READ ME in the
yellow group titled PDF Generator API

---

**FlowFuse Inc.**

name: Downtime Data \n Production Data

2: Click to generate and insert demo data.

READ ME...
info:
### Customisation

The flows in this blueprint depend on the naming of data fields

Therefore, if your database tables have alternative names, you will need
to update the aliases in the queries.

For example, the "Facilities" database node returns 
`[{id,name,location}, ...]`

```sql
SELECT
    f.id as id, 
    f.name as name, 
    f.location as location
FROM
    Facilities f
WHERE
    f.id = $facility_id;
```

If the fields and/or tables in your database are 
different, you can update the aliases as follows...

```sql
SELECT
    f.ident as id, 
    f.unit_name as name, 
    f.area as location
FROM
    line_table f
WHERE
    f.ident = $facility_id;
```

---

**FlowFuse Inc.**

sql:
CREATE TABLE StoppageReasons (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, -- Use UUIDs as TEXT in SQLite
    reason_code TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    reason_description TEXT NOT NULL,
    category TEXT NOT NULL,
    is_planned INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_planned IN (0, 1)),
    is_active INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 1 CHECK (is_active IN (0, 1)),
    priority_level INTEGER, -- e.g., 1 (high) to 5 (low)
    requires_approval INTEGER DEFAULT 0 CHECK (requires_approval IN (0, 1)),
    is_user_selectable INTEGER DEFAULT 1 CHECK (is_user_selectable IN (0, 1)),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT (datetime('now'))
);
name: StoppageReasons

sql:
CREATE TABLE Facilities (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    name TEXT NOT NULL,
    type TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (type IN ('OU', 'LINE', 'FACILITY')),
    parent_id TEXT, -- NULL if it's a top-level LINE
    location TEXT, -- optional: building, zone, etc.
    shift_pattern TEXT,
    asset_type TEXT,
    is_active INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 1 CHECK (is_active IN (0,1)),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    FOREIGN KEY (parent_id) REFERENCES Facilities(id)
);
name: Facilities

sql:
CREATE TABLE ShiftPatterns (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    pattern TEXT NOT NULL,      -- e.g. '2-shift', '3-shift'
    shift TEXT NOT NULL,      -- e.g. 'Days', 'Lates'
    dow INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (dow BETWEEN 0 AND 6),  -- 0 = Sunday
    name TEXT,                     -- Friendly name like "Monday Dayshift"
    start_time TEXT NOT NULL,      -- '08:00:00'
    is_active INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 1 CHECK (is_active IN (0, 1)),
    duration_minutes INTEGER NOT NULL,
    created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    updated_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now'))
);
name: ShiftPatterns

sql:
CREATE TABLE PlannedShifts (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
    facility_id TEXT NOT NULL,             -- Production facility
    pattern_id TEXT NOT NULL,
    pattern TEXT NOT NULL,      -- e.g. '2-shift', '3-shift'
    shift TEXT NOT NULL,      -- e.g. 'Days', 'Lates'
    shift_name TEXT NOT NULL,      -- e.g. 'Friday Shayshift'
    shift_date TEXT NOT NULL,              -- e.g. '2025-05-03'
    start_datetime TEXT NOT NULL,          -- Full ISO: '2025-05-03T08:00:00'
    end_datetime TEXT NOT NULL,
    duration_minutes INTEGER NOT NULL,
    is_cancelled INTEGER DEFAULT 0 CHECK (is_cancelled IN (0,1)),
    notes TEXT,
    created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    updated_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    FOREIGN KEY (facility_id) REFERENCES Facilities(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (pattern_id) REFERENCES ShiftPatterns(id)
);
name: PlannedShifts

sql:
CREATE TABLE ProductionData (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
    facility_id TEXT NOT NULL,
    planned_shift_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    shift_date TEXT NOT NULL,
    planned_runtime_minutes INTEGER NOT NULL,
    runtime_minutes INTEGER NOT NULL,
    planned_downtime_seconds INTEGER NOT NULL,
    unplanned_downtime_seconds INTEGER NOT NULL,
    total_units INTEGER NOT NULL,
    good_units INTEGER NOT NULL,
    scrap_units INTEGER NOT NULL,
    availability REAL,
    performance REAL,
    quality REAL,
    oee_score REAL,
    created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    updated_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    FOREIGN KEY (facility_id) REFERENCES Facilities(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (planned_shift_id) REFERENCES PlannedShifts(id)
);
name: ProductionData

sql:
CREATE TABLE DowntimeData (
    id                        INTEGER       PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
    facility_id               TEXT NOT NULL,
    planned_shift_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    shift_date TEXT NOT NULL,
    downtime_start            DATETIME      NOT NULL,
    downtime_end              DATETIME      NOT NULL,
    downtime_duration_seconds INTEGER       NOT NULL,
    planned_stop              INTEGER DEFAULT 0 CHECK (planned_stop IN (0,1)),
    stoppage_reason_id           TEXT          NOT NULL,
    stoppage_reason_override_id           TEXT,
    notes TEXT,
    created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
    FOREIGN KEY (facility_id) REFERENCES Facilities(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (stoppage_reason_id) REFERENCES StoppageReasons(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (planned_shift_id) REFERENCES PlannedShifts(id)

);
name: DowntimeData

sql:
SELECT
    dd.id as id,
    dd.facility_id as facility_id,
    dd.planned_shift_id as planned_shift_id,
    dd.shift_date as shift_date,
    dd.downtime_start as downtime_start,
    dd.downtime_end as downtime_end,
    dd.downtime_duration_seconds as downtime_duration_seconds,
    dd.planned_stop as planned_stop,
    dd.stoppage_reason_id as stoppage_reason_id,
    dd.stoppage_reason_override_id as stoppage_reason_override_id,
    dd.notes as notes,
    sr.reason_code as reason_code,
    sr.reason_description as reason_description,
    sr.category as category,
    sr.is_planned as is_planned
FROM
    DowntimeData dd
JOIN
    StoppageReasons sr ON dd.stoppage_reason_id = sr.id
WHERE
    dd.facility_id = $facility_id
    AND dd.planned_shift_id = $shift_id;
    -- AND dd.shift_date = $shift_date
name: DowntimeData

sql:
SELECT 
    ps.id as id,
    ps.shift as shift
FROM PlannedShifts ps
WHERE ps.shift_date = $shift_date AND ps.facility_id = $facility_id
name: PlannedShifts

sql:
SELECT
    f.id as id, 
    f.name as name, 
    f.location as location
FROM
    Facilities f
WHERE
    f.id = $facility_id;
name: Facilities

sql:
SELECT
    ps.id as id,
    ps.pattern as pattern, 
    ps.shift as shift,
    ps.shift_name as shift_name,
    ps.shift_date as shift_date,
    ps.start_datetime as start_datetime, 
    ps.end_datetime as end_datetime, 
    ps.duration_minutes as duration_minutes 
FROM
    PlannedShifts ps
WHERE
    ps.id = $shift_id;
name: PlannedShifts

sql:
SELECT
    pd.id as id,
    pd.planned_runtime_minutes as planned_runtime_minutes,
    pd.runtime_minutes as runtime_minutes,
    pd.shift_date as shift_date,
    pd.planned_downtime_seconds as planned_downtime_seconds,
    pd.unplanned_downtime_seconds as unplanned_downtime_seconds,
    pd.total_units as total_units,
    pd.good_units as good_units,
    pd.scrap_units as scrap_units,
    pd.availability as availability,
    pd.performance as performance,
    pd.quality as quality,
    pd.oee_score as oee_score
FROM
    ProductionData pd
WHERE
    pd.facility_id = $facility_id
    AND pd.planned_shift_id = $shift_id;
name: ProductionData
Get selected facility
func:
const Facilities = global.get('reporting.tables.Facilities')
const facility_id = msg.payload
let facility = Facilities.find(e => e.id === facility_id) || null
msg.facility_id = facility_id
msg.facility = facility
msg.payload = facility
return msg;

name: Report Viewer
READ ME...
info:
### Dashboard flows

Here we use only dashboard built-in controls to present
cascading choices from the Facility selection through to
the Date.  

We embed an iFrame into the `ui-template` node to present
the compiled PDF report.  If the browser you are using does
not support embeded PDFs, a download button is also avaiable
to save it for later viewing in a PDF application.


NOTE:
To view the Dashboard - Open the "Dashboard 2.0" sidebar, and click "Open Dashboard"

---

**FlowFuse Inc.**

name: Gather the parent line names from global context to generate first dropdown options
Based on the parent selection, generate the facility dropdown options
Based on the parent selection, eable the production date picker
Based on the parent selection and date selected, generate the avaiable shift dropdown options
Now that all form fields are set, we can enable the "Shift Report" button
Lastly, use a ui-template to embed a PDF viewer and offer a download link
To view the Dashboard - Open the "Dashboard 2.0" sidebar, and click "Open Dashboard"
